job_description: AWS Architect - job post Itexpertus Plano, TX Contract Apply now Apply now save-icon Job details Job Type Contract AWS Architect Plano, TX Long-term Contract Role and Responsibilities: Define and communicate complex technical and operational solutions and translate complex topics into simple business language to drive the value alignment. Compare and position tradeoffs between private and hybrid cloud solutions Adopt and plan for implementation of Industry best practices for connected vehicle systems Provide domain expertise in various decisions ranging from first cut feature analysis, providing heads-up on technical challenges with Executives, sharing inputs integrated plan for feature rollout and informing on the feature adoption approach. Define and Support enterprise system integration for features of the connected vehicle ecosystem Define standards for information collection and data storage architectures for connected vehicle entities. Connected Vehicle solutions are built on Cloud based platforms, security of this platform from various external threats and attack vectors is key to preventing financial losses resulting from compliance violations, data breaches, Customer experience impact and resulting loss in brand value. Lead the architecture discussions for integration with Partner systems aligning with global architecture principles and business requirements Technology adoption: Work on Proof of Concepts for adopting new cloud native apps and hybrid apps to resolve critical technical issues which can address business and technical goals Lead and review architectural discussions with various third-party products and Cloud providers Mentor and guide the business architects in arriving at right solution for various business requirements Work alongside the Delivery leads and provide status updates on architecture and design level approvals and blockers. Collaborate with the application, data, and infrastructure architects on defining, designing and delivering cloud specific technical architectures, patterns, technical quality, risks and operations of cloud architecture solutions for cloud native applications and cloud migrated applications. Crate level 1 architecture diagrams to define vehicle to cloud, channel to cloud and system architecture for the connected vehicle program Work with the cyber security and the web security team to ensure the compliance to the technical solution being implemented Review and support technical architectures for green field and brownfield identity management solution to support authentication of services available at the vehicle, user channels, conversational systems and third party systems Define and review cloud governance practices on public cloud based on industry standard reference architectures and well architected frameworks Support a global DevOps solution to integrate with the Global deployment and a global release management process Experience & Qualifications: 15 years' experience in Information Technology, 5-8+ years in an Architecture environment Certified AWS solution architect Experience with Automotive data structure of vehicle management Good understand the business flow and data flow for Dealer Systems. Proficiency in programming languages like Java, JavaScript, Python, SQL. Familiarity with frameworks and tools like Spring, JEE, Angular, React, jQuery, Hibernate, Maven, Tomcat, Docker, Git. Experience with event-based and message-driven distributed system - knowledge of Kafka, JMS, RabbitMQ, AWS Kinesis or similar Experience with container orchestration such Kubernetes, Mesos and containers such as Docker Hands-on experience in leading organizations through Cloud adoption and migration along with understanding of design standard methodologies for AWS (certification is preferred). You have a working knowledge of architecture frameworks Expertise with different architecture and design patterns and tools Consistent record of driving and leading large-scale architectural projects Experience in reviewing and selecting Technical and Applications Architectures solutions Experience of working with Technical and Application Architects Solid hands-on experience on software development life cycles Experience in Cloud transformation projects Solid experience working with diverse technology platforms You should successfully mentor developers who are looking to become architects Bachelor's or master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology or relevant field. Job Type: Contract Experience: Azure: 10 years (Required) AWS: 10 years (Required) License/Certification: AWS Certification (Required) Work Location: On the road If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.

Cross-browser development o Datastores such as MongoDB, Cassandra, Redis, Elasticsearch, Postgress, Oracle. Should have experience in leading DevOps practices for a large program. Ability to translate complex data sets and research into simple business recommendations. JD has been updated. Suppliers can submit candidate local to either Enon or Irving and those candidates must be open to hybrid work schedule. PMP certified is a MUST, please attach certification with resume. Program Manager Key Duties And Responsibilities: The IT Infrastructure Program manager is responsible for establishing governance for managing and providing direction for infrastructure programs of varying size and complexity from initiation through completion across cross-functional project teams. In this role, you will liaise between business stakeholders and our IT department, balancing business needs with hardware capacity and supporting seamless integration. You will review all project requirements and determine scheduling, budgeting, and resource needs. In addition, you will ensure the scope of work is well-defined and consider the integration of systems to ensure a seamless deployment. In addition to educational qualifications, applicants should have experience in IT project planning and be comfortable adhering to strict deadlines. Manages the day-to-day aspects of a project(s) to deliver high-quality, on time, on budget outcomes within the project scope. Coordinates the identification and planning of all project work streams, including working with each functional manager and/or Project Manager to plan work product schedules, identify key milestones, manage dependencies, identify, track, and manage risks/issues/decisions, and report on project progress. Implements consistent process and tools and identify emerging best practices and issues to help continuously advance project methods and practices. Work closely with executives, business unit leaders and product owners to educate organizations to use a variety of approaches to deliver customer value in both business and IT teams. Provide expertise to align multiple teams, collaborate and facilitate quarterly planning with large groups, manage portfolio backlog and facilitate decision making with project stakeholders, Senior Leaders, and Architects. Coaches, mentors, and provides guidance to all project team members. Provide feedback to management at all levels regarding the progress project teams Leads and oversees the identification, execution, and updating of project timelines, tasks/responsibilities, and deliverables. Works with project team to identify project risks and mitigation plans, resolve issues, and eliminate project challenges. Coordinates and responds to project changes, including escalating project issues and decisions as needed. Provides strong leadership capabilities to lead and direct project teams, leading team decision-making processes, and cultivating an environment of healthy team debate and collaboration. Ability to build project plans for Agile and Waterfall methodologies to align with infrastructure resources. Specific Knowledge And Skills: Project management experience and knowledge of concepts and practices. 10+ years of IT Project management experience 5+ years of IT Infrastructure Project management Experience in leading programs for large network/datacenter projects & voice projects is a MUST. Ability to lead, manage, coordinate, plan and deliver projects on-time, on-budget, on-scope with high quality. Experience with digital transformations (Waterfall to Agile). Experience managing vendor contract deliverables to ensure they are met and accepted. Ability to demonstrate and apply a thorough understanding of complex information systems and technology organizations. Experience developing and managing software, hardware, and services contracts. EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE: EDUCATION: Bachelors/4 Yr Degree YEARS OF RELEVANT WORK EXPERIENCE: 10+ years YEARS OF MANAGEMENT EXPERIENCE: NA CERTIFICATIONS / LICENSES: Project Management Professional (PMP) required. Please attach certification with resume. Job Type: Contract Pay: $85.00 - $90.00 per hour Schedule: On call Ability to commute/relocate: Irving, TX 75063: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Experience: IT Infrastructure Project management,Data center,Cloud: 10 years (Preferred) License/Certification: PMP (Preferred) Work Location: Hybrid remote in Irving, TX 75063 If you require alternative methods of application or screening, you must approach the employer directly to request this as Indeed is not responsible for the employer's application process.
